website_summaries.verdict: A popular deep fryer from a top brand in kitchen appliances, this 3.2-liter model is a great deal for the money.
pros: Sustains heat better than most of the fryers on the market
Includes stainless steel mesh basket with cool-touch handle
cons: Short cord and difficult to strain oil when you are done cooking

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made !
customer_reviews.text: So cheaply made. No on off switch Metal edges sharp. Made just a cheap as possible and not fall apart. Yes it will heat oil. Cuisinart has a good name but not for much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ralph Kimbrough

customer_reviews.title: FAULTY HEATING Design
customer_reviews.text: I am not the first person to discuss this heating issue! I did not believe what they said and purchased 1 for our family gathering! BIG MISTAKE! 3 hours after being turned on the temperature was 200 degrees and then for some poorly engineered reason ,the unit shut OFF. I suggest AMAZON discontinue selling this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Levenhagen

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous temperature control
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my twenty year old Delonghi fryer that is just worn out. I love my Cusinart food processor and rotisserie, so how could I go wrong? This unit has faulty temperature control. If I set at the recommend temperature of 375 F it will kick off the high temperature safety. The dial is a quarter turn off on temperature indicator. I verified this with a instant read cooking thermometer. Not a safe device. Make sure you verify temps independent of the dial.
customer_reviews.author: Alan B.

customer_reviews.title: Great fryer
customer_reviews.text: Showed up today and I was ready! Fries, mozz sticks, onion rings, and mushrooms. Cooked them all at 350° for 3 minutes. Love the built in timer. All the food was cooked perfectly. I didn’t make a big batch, I did separate little batches of each, but when it only takes 3 minutes, who cares! Wings will be next 😁
customer_reviews.author: T Bones

customer_reviews.title: An OK deep fryer
customer_reviews.text: It works well - heats the oil and maintains temperature well. The basket, however, is fairly wide mesh, so coatings tend to drip through and clog up the mesh. Don't know if this is typical of deep fryers - our first one. Makes great French fries and funnel cakes, but trying to deep fry coated meat was a bit frustrating. The unit does clean up pretty well, other than the mesh, which takes a bit of effort. Overall, not a bad fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Thompson

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty small
customer_reviews.text: The temp dial is very flimsy and the top latch expands when oil gets hot and falls off(useless).Overall i'm disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Crispy Fries Everytime
customer_reviews.text: Many people have a negative view about deep fried foods. Correctly deep frying any food starts with having equipment that is temperature accurate. Recently I did a kitchen paper test. I showed some friends how to fry french fries that are not oil or soggy and how to fry crispy fish and chicken that doesn't ooze cooking oil. This deep fryer is easy to clean and give consistent results. It gets two thumbs up from me.
customer_reviews.author: WendyD

customer_reviews.title: Cover is keep on falling off
customer_reviews.text: I don't know mine had broken lid from the beginning. But everytime I opend the lid it fall off from machine, so need to assemble again and again.. Otherwise it is very small and functional. Enough for making kids snack, fried chicken nuggets. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job just fine
customer_reviews.text: I'm not looking for a huge fryer and I'm not looking to spend a lot of money. I'm looking to make some donuts occasionally and some crispy chicken. This does the trick. The container isn't huge so it doesnt require a lot of 'investment' oil. It's also pretty small so it easily fits in my cabinet when not in use. And the charcoal filter keeps the smell down. It's easy to use and not a lot of money. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking small fryer only for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Perez

customer_reviews.title: small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: Got this thing a few days ago. My 1st thought was, wow it's small. Then when I added some oil to the fill line I was like wow that's barely any in there. So I had some friends over and we gave it a run. I was able to do a 2lb bag of frozen fries in 3 batches and chicken thighs and fried calamari. I gotta say it worked perfectly. After a few hours for cooling it was easy to clean. the top comes off and it is small enough to easily pour out the used oil. I'm very impressed. It's an excellent size for one or two people.
customer_reviews.author: jerry d

customer_reviews.title: deep fryer
customer_reviews.text: we have tried the cooker a few times and it does take to long to cook seems as if it does not get hot enough French fries come out with the oil in them because they have to cook to long to get done breaded items the same and I do not like electric connection replaced it with the presto grand daddy which does the job very well the Cuisinart is not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: bob*289

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Fried Pies!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this fryer because I've been wanting to make some homemade fried pies and regular frying skillets just don't do the job right! If you want to have the right tool for the job, this fryer is great! The depth is perfect, heats to the right temperature pretty quickly, cooks evenly, and the basket which may be lifted out and hung on the side to drain the grease from food minimizes waste. It is simple to assemble/disassemble and cleans up easily. Get ya one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Dollar Store Quality
customer_reviews.text: thin light weight tin outter housing. Thin hard plastic handles that feel like they will snap off. Timer is a cheap button battery timer that looks like a throw away. Inner tank is a little heavier tin than outter shell. But still thin and stamped out. Cover is really thin tin stamped out. Again thin hard plastic handle. I have a Cuisinart Coffee Maker and love it. This Deep Fryer they should be ashamed of even putting their name on it.
customer_reviews.author: Draxx

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Customer support??? Quality?
customer_reviews.text: I bought Cuisinart because I wanted a solid quality unit. I'm underwhelmed. 2 of the feet were firmly attached, 1 was floating around in the box, 1 was missing. Phone up Cuisinart Customer Support for a new foot. Nope I have to return the whole unit and wait 10-15 days!!! Plus the all that cost of shipping the product about - even if they pay!! Or I'm politely told to get myself down to the hardware store and find a generic solution. I haven't used the unit, but it looks cheap and lightweight too me. Typical, once good name, now produced on the cheap in China :-(
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased with the Results
customer_reviews.text: This Deep Fryer met my expectations (I have a smaller Cuisinart fryer that is great for smaller amounts of food). I was able to cook full chicken wings in batches to feed a hungry party crowd. Temperatures were very consistent and easy to monitor. Clean up was fairly easy as this is still a manageable size unit, and light weight. Components and design was easy to use. Good value for the price
customer_reviews.author: RidgeviewSales

customer_reviews.title: Fry-Day For You, But Not For Hungry Crowd.
customer_reviews.text: It’s the smaller version of a deep fryer so don’t expect it to handle a large load of food at one time. A chicken leg and a thigh, or 6 wings , or a nice 1 1/2 portions of fries is what you can expect it to cook at one time.. Keeps the temperature where you set it and clean-up is fairly easy. Requires little counter space and is easy on the oil Just keep in mind what it can handle and you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Al B

customer_reviews.title: This fryer is cheaply build.
customer_reviews.text: This fryer is disappointing for its poor execution. The product could has well have been designed by an accountant, every part feels cheap and the assembly is imprecise to boot. Furthermore the thermostat reads about 20 deg. F higher than the oil. I think for the money there are better fryers out there. The old fryer was from Waring, the construction was head and shoulders better, and it lasted 12 + yrs. Regret buying this one because of the Cuisinart name.
customer_reviews.author: M. Moisson

customer_reviews.title: Don' t Buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for christmas and only used it 3 times the second time it did not work as well and I thought it was user fault so I tried it a third time and it is broken, the oil does not heat up and the temperature control is broken. I got a faulty fryer. I will just have to trash it as it is useless now as the return window is closed. What a bummer. DO NOT BUY this fryer. I would give is a 0 star but there is no option for a 0
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: this item does not work!
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this product. the reviews had been really good. However, it does not work. We have gotten it to work twice, but the other dozen or so times, It just will NOT heat up. I have contacted customer service and have NOT gotten a response. I cannot find a way to send it back. As I said first, I am very disappointed, unhappy and frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: babear9

customer_reviews.title: Design Fault & NOT USER FRIENDLY
customer_reviews.text: I have numerous Cuisiart app licenses in my home; all top notch and user friendly. This deep fat fryer IS NOT USER FRIENDLY. There is a design fault in the removable basket handle. In either of it’s two usable positions it IS NOT user friendly, very awkward to use as it does not conform to the usable range of the human hand.
customer_reviews.author: Nudist Van

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Good for Small Batches
customer_reviews.text: First use case: french fries. Heats up reasonably quickly. The small size is great for storing and when using, but keep in mind you can't cook a huge amount at a time. Cleans up easily. I like the fact that there's not a separate element to deal with and clean. But the inner tray is not removable, so you have to be careful when washing it so as not to get the main part wet from the bottom. Overall, works very well to satisfy my desire for fresh cooked Belgian style fries.
customer_reviews.author: Thing

customer_reviews.title: CAPACITY
customer_reviews.text: Having used a Fry Daddy fryer for many decades, I finally desired one with variable temperature for foods that require longer time at lower cooking temperature . The best feature of this product is the ability to set the cooking temperature, which I did find to be accurate. In that regard this does an excellent job. The drawback, however, is that the maximum oil level is too low to cover thicker foods, something not experienced with the Fry Daddy despite each having similar 1 liter capacity. It's a matter of the rectangular shape which lowers the depth of the oil. Having only used it once I cannot comment on long-term reliability of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I find it easy to clean and the removeable oil bin is what makes clean up fairly easy. I've fried fish and chicken (legs and thighs) so far and both have come out great. Some reviewers ding the quality which to me is high, at first the outershell the oil bin sits in does seem a little lighter/thin than it should be but honestly it is sufficient for what for the intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: DQ in TN

customer_reviews.title: Easy to cleannd I recommend the filters and filter support frame ...
customer_reviews.text: I noticed many complaints on this unit but the complaints seemed to be from people who didn't cook very much. I found no issues. Easy tocleannd I recommend the filters and filter support frame to complete the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: nathaniel swan

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected and is just the right size for this family of 3! I didn't want anything larger due to the amount of oil I would have to waste. I don't like reusing the same oil very long. I do not fry food all that much, but when I do, it's french frys!
customer_reviews.author: angelaarden

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2...🙆‍♀️
customer_reviews.text: Cute and little! Now only day 2 However exactly what we wanted... perfect for honey an me ... 2 servings of fries or 6 mozzarella sticks.., perfect... Now for those of you that don’t want a small fryer please don’t buy this and complain on its size and give a poor review.. just pay attention to what the hell your buying!
customer_reviews.author: PuppyKisser

customer_reviews.title: Must be for a dollhouse!
customer_reviews.text: OMG this thi g is SUPER tiny!!! It may only cook 2 5 inch fish sticks at a time. it is ridiculous!!! Probably not even big enough even if you live alone and only cook for yourself. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: R. Schnoor

customer_reviews.title: Great little deep fryer.
customer_reviews.text: I live alone and wanted a small deep fryer. My daughter has a unit like this and recommended it to me. This little unit is perfect for one or two people it seems. Works like a charm. my only reservation is it takes a fair amount of time cleaning all the oil from the inside and outside of the fryer to keep it looking nice. Otherwise, really like everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Paulus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for this single gent!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean. Works very well. Perfect for me. Not meant for large (or small) family. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Corona

customer_reviews.title: Skip this one.
customer_reviews.text: This is about the size of a toaster. I can make 2 servings of hash browns at a time. Seriously, it's small. The non-stick coating has already worn away where the basket sits while frying and I've used it less than 10 times. The heating is inconsistent and takes several minutes to heat despite its tiny size.
customer_reviews.author: JennMe013

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY CUISINART!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Sept 16th 2018, It totally died on Oct 24th. Missed the Amazon return period by 6 days. Call Cuisinart, they'll replace if I pay to ship it back to them PLUS a $10 check. Why should I have to pay for their defective product?
customer_reviews.author: Yabun

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've been thru several options this year including an air fryer (what a joke!) This one is about the size of a toaster, perfect for my smallish kitchen, heats quickly to it's highest temp and has a light that lets me know when it's ready. Fries my morning little square hash browns perfectly and quickly. What's not to love?!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: This is the second one I have bought
customer_reviews.text: We bought exactly the same kind 10 years ago and used it very well. The old one started to have oil leakage issue after 10 years. So we bought the second one. We really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Moxie

customer_reviews.title: I FINALLY threw it out
customer_reviews.text: I tried for months but I got burned several times because the lid is not permanently fastened. It fell off Frequently and steam burned me. The temperature dial split and could not be fixed. The magnetic power cord doesn’t stay attached and I had to jiggle it several times during frying. This is an awful product. Shame on Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn

customer_reviews.title: Good enough.. just don't abuse it.
customer_reviews.text: It's been almost a year since I bought this. It's still works, temperature still in good condition, just make sure to check the temp of oil separately cause it's not reliable. It does get hot over 400 degrees better than not going to high. Temperature still adjustable after being used multiple times, I probably have this over 400 hours of usage. From o to 400degress will probably take 10-15mins. Easy to clean. Very convenient, can be used as commercial.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Perry

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty well. My big problem is that the openings ...
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty well. My big problem is that the openings on the inside of the top are very sharp. While hand washing it, I opened a gash in my thumb that took 40 minutes to stop bleeding. Absolutely no reason why these openings should be sharp. Huge problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Beason

customer_reviews.title: There are some safety issues.
customer_reviews.text: I used it 3 times doing french fries. Found it not comfortable to use and threw it away. The fries came out tasting very good. But did not like the popping sound of the oil. The cord in the back I find for safety as it pulls out quickly but still scary when it happens and you have hot oil. Then the third time I used it the lid came off completely and was so scared with hot oil and fries cooking. I called it done for and threw it away not a safe fryer to use.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Rose

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for a few months now, and I just love it. It uses very little oil, and takes up very little space. This is not for a big family. This is made for one or two people. When you just want one serving of french fries etc. it is perfect. The lid is really nice and you don't have to "program" it! Very simple to use. I love the magnet cord. It was a little strange at first, but is really handy to have.
customer_reviews.author: Red Dove

customer_reviews.title: Power Cable Connection Not Good
customer_reviews.text: Power Cable Connection Not Good. Just received, un-boxed and all looked good. Plugged the power cord into the unit and it fell off! Plugged in again and again and with the slightest movement it falls off. It is held on by a magnet which appears to be very weak. The feet are not holding it in place so it was easy to move it. With that being so poorly designed decided not to go any further and boxed it back up.
customer_reviews.author: N2WATA

customer_reviews.title: Great fryer
customer_reviews.text: The size and utility of this appliance is perfect for us. I recommend following the instructions because of handling hot oil. Since I bought it to make cannoli shells, I have to use the highest setting of 375 degrees. What I found helpful to the oil popping when I needed to remove the shells was to lower the temperature for a a few seconds. My only complaint is the control button is not so steady. Otherwise, this is the perfect appliance addition to our kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little fryer!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice deep fryer for 1 or 2 people. I use two 16oz bottles of unrefined peanut oil for healthy cooking and change the oil after about 8 uses. It measures 11" x 8" x 8" so it doesn't take up hardly any counter space. Cooking two breaded chicken legs only takes 25 minutes, fully cooked and crispy.....still experimenting with the French fries. Includes a nice stainless steel basket with handle and has a "Ready" light when the temperature of the oil reaches the setting. I really like this fryer and think it is well worth having.
customer_reviews.author: RickTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: it behaves exactly as would be expected and we are pleased.
customer_reviews.text: we have used this for French fries, wings, pork sandwich, etc. It heats in a reasonable amount of time and recovers readily when a load of frozen French fries in inserted. It is hot enough that the food is not greasy. In general it behaves exactly as would be expected and we are pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley D. Eason

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: Our household is shrinking as the kids are moving out. We purchased this small deep fryer for the 3 of us that are left. It is perfect for doing small amounts of deep frying and does not take up too much space. We are trying not to overeat and we like the idea that we can only cook so many at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Small but does a good job!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite thing about this little deep fryer is being able to control the temp.. Who says you cannot use a good quality olive oil and use a deep fryer.. As long as you can control the temp to about 370.. a good olive oil will do great! I'm not saying deep fried food is good for you but using olive oil makes it seem a little healthier and it tastes wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a deep fryer for a while. It's a tad smaller than i expected, but i learned quickly that you don't need a restaurant sized fryer for yummy dinner. It heats up quick and i've never made better fries in my home! We may get fat from all the food I want to make for dinner everyday now
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is sturdy and solid
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this fryer for over a year and like its results and easy to use and clean features. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: cybercitizen

customer_reviews.title: nice and compact
customer_reviews.text: everything works as described I love it, the power cord is a little too short and the way is plug in the machine needs to be improved it is hard to keep it in place especially with the short cord but overall i do recommend the item, the oil gets hot quickly the size is perfect I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: dennis o.

customer_reviews.title: We have been missing this jewel !!  No more rubber fish !!
customer_reviews.text: Tired of eating rubbery fish after frying - Buy this Fryer you will not regret it. I never thought I would be able to cook fish so perfect. I like this much better than the outdoor fryer. It controls the heat just right you could not ask for better. I have no problem cleaning this fryer up and it packs inside itself so well.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: I personally prefer stainless steel as they can withstand harsh cleaning. This one is just the perfect size as I have a big family. There is a green light that comes on once the fryer temperature is achieved. Cleaning is easy because you can just lift up the frying unit. Just perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Anni

customer_reviews.title: Worked well until it failed after 2 years, but for the price, I don't mind.
customer_reviews.text: Good point would be that it's a no-frills simple thing. No digital display or button. Just a tempurature set knob. it's on whenever it's plugged in. The interior corners aren't quite round enough to clean easily. And of course mine stopped working after two years. No idea why.
customer_reviews.author: N. H. Nifong

customer_reviews.title: Great fryer
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't set this on my counter for everyday use. It's a bit big for that but as far as basket size and functionality it is a great fryer. We used it for a "no fair, no Fair!" party in the back yard and it was great. I will find a way to use it at parties in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: All around great product, I use this to deep fry just about everything and it all comes out perfect. My only problem I encountered was some foods sticking to the basket, but a quick spray of the basket with some PAM before putting in the food did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Deep Fat Fryer
customer_reviews.text: Fast to reach temperature and quick recovery. Small and just right for family of two. (perhaps more, we are only two). Outstanding fish and chips on first try. Love the fact that all except the heating element can go into dishwasher. Beats my old Frydaddy to pieces. Excellent product. alanjesq
customer_reviews.author: alanjesq

customer_reviews.title: perfect little fryer!
customer_reviews.text: It's a good size for small batches. Fast heating up the oil and it holds temperature really good unless you overload it. Safety cord is good and the fryer cleans up easily. I fry outside at my BBQ station so I don't have to use the lid. Just one more thing to clean up
customer_reviews.author: D Dubb

customer_reviews.title: Very Shoddy
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised by this fryer, I ordered it because of the name brand that usually means quality, it is very shoddy and cheap construction, i don't think it will hold up, so i will be returning it without using and try the T-Fal deep fat fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Puddin1950

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Two!
customer_reviews.text: We love this. It’s perfect for two people. We’ve fried French fries, onion rings & shrimp in it. I have had no trouble with the magnetic plug coming out, it’s truly a great safety feature. Between uses I just store the whole unit in a spare refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: Karla

customer_reviews.title: It's a good little fryer
customer_reviews.text: It's a good little fryer. I like that it doesn't take up a lot of space on the counter and it's easy to store away. It's easy to use and works well. It's really easy to clean. The part of the knob that shows the temperature broke off after the second use, though. That's a little annoying, but isn't that big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Key

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Fryer
customer_reviews.text: It is little but it does a great job. For a single serving it's great. Only really works for one person. If you need more then of course you have to do multiple batches and the food won't be ready at the same time. I'd purchase it again as it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Wilson

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LITTLE DYNAMO OF A FRYER!
customer_reviews.text: If you understand that this is a small fryer, it still can handle the job. Heat is even throughout the fryer and things come out uniformly golden brown. Need things fast? Frying time is is an hour and I am putting the chicken on around 9:30.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Pinero

customer_reviews.title: Temperature extremely inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this, being a Cuisinart product, but I think I got either a knock-off or a lemon. First, the unit did not come with a manual or any paperwork, which was strange. More importantly, the temperature gauge was extremely inaccurate. I checked the temperature of the oil with a reliable digital candy thermometer and found the oil to be 30+ degrees higher than the temperature I selected on the dial. The whole point of using a deep fryer is to "set it and forget it" - not possible if the temperature gauge doesn't work. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie E.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: This deep frying is awesome! It takes about a half bottle of oil to fill and it can be stored just about any where because of the size. But don't let the size fool you! I'm able to feed a family of 5 using this. It's fast and simple and we love it! I love that it closes so there is no splatter while cooking. Also no oil fumes because there is a filter! so easy to clean and replace oil as well! It's a must have for any kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Marwah

customer_reviews.title: Broke on the second use.
customer_reviews.text: Used one time then it broke. Will no longer heat up. Followed all the directions, was careful about not getting water on it when cleaning, etc. My wife really liked this fryer so it was very disappointing. As much as I would like to buy it again we are afraid to.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: It didn't even work through one cooking. The light came on at 350, when I put my okra in, I put the top on it and came back a minute or two later, noticed I didn't see no steam, the light was still on the ready mode and the oil was cooling down. Unplugged it and started again and light was still on the ready mode. Its junk! Thanks to Amazon for there great return policy!!
customer_reviews.author: William Daryl Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Compact, & Perfect for 2 people
customer_reviews.text: I love this little fryer! It's compact size is very convenient and doesn't take up much counter space. I really love that the main fry compartment is not where the heating element is, so if you need to fry without the basket you can! Easy to use, Easy to clean. Frying with the top down really decreases the amount of splatter. Perfect for 2 people. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Cute:Compact,Cool Temperture
customer_reviews.text: Best: requires very little oil,Worse:Temperture,even at max setting too low
customer_reviews.author: Davy boy

customer_reviews.title: Slow to heat but works very well
customer_reviews.text: Love the size. Pain to keep clean. Gets hot pretty quick. It does works well. Unfortunately the dial is of poor quality. This is my second one first one worked well for 5 or 6 years. Then got slow to heat and get to temp.
customer_reviews.author: Ken W.

customer_reviews.title: ... the job done doesn’t stink up the house works great!
customer_reviews.text: A bit smaller than I expected but it still gets the job done doesn’t stink up the house works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I and my husband like this. He is the "deep fryer" in the ...
customer_reviews.text: I and my husband like this. He is the "deep fryer" in the family. The only thing is it seems to take awhile to heat the oil, but that could be because it takes a lot of oil (almost a gallon). It is large.
customer_reviews.author: K. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 people. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one just like it. Great size for 2 people. Heating coils are not exposed. Therefore, cleaning is easy. Just like cleaning out the interior of a smooth pot.
customer_reviews.author: SM from VA

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Owned this for 5 months. Probably used it 12 times. The fryer keeps popping it's reset button. Finally the button just won't go back in and the unit doesn't work. Quality of product is poor. Very thin metal. I would suggest buying a different fryer. Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanell Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Can't reach 375
customer_reviews.text: This fryer does not heat up to 375, just gets to about 300 and starts to fall off. Was hoping that spending upwards $100 would get me a decent piece of equipment but alas this thing fails to deliver entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Knighton

customer_reviews.title: Decent capacity for home fryer
customer_reviews.text: Like the size of the fryer for capacity and storage. Does a good job for home use. The temperature scale numbering seems odd since most foods purchased use 350 degrees and the dial setting is 355???
customer_reviews.author: MNSZC5

customer_reviews.title: Great fryer, small footprint on my counter
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these at a department store in Medellin Colombia, recently moved again for work, could not find, presto on Amazon found it. I like this for my counter as a small foot print compare to the others, nice wire basket, easy to clean, cook tortilla chips for parties and Chicken Wings, excellent. The temp gauge actually works, the back is a magnet plug, easy to un-plug just pull, just the perfect size, AND use it for frozen french frys is our other cooking item.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great fryer
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best fryer I’ve owned. I like having the large basket and cleanup is so much easier with the removable heating element. It heats up pretty fast and the temperature seems right.
customer_reviews.author: David Georgiades

customer_reviews.title: Product leaks all over the place dangerous and can’t be used
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift to my mom and after a few months I asked her how she liked it and she told me the oil was leaking out when being stored. She stopped using it and got rid of it. She didn’t want to say anything but finally did. The manufacturer shou definitely look into the problem.
customer_reviews.author: robert a.

customer_reviews.title: Temperature not hot enough for frying
customer_reviews.text: Temperature only reached to 350° when not frying, however, when frying temperature even dropped down ~325° and never able to get back to 350°.
customer_reviews.author: Benson Pham

customer_reviews.title: Broke in three months!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent until it quit heating at just three months old. The manufacturer's warranty requires buyer to pay shipping both ways.
customer_reviews.author: amy m.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this Fryer!
customer_reviews.text: This cuisinart can fry a whole bag of frozen french fries easily. Easy to use, and the fryer really makes your food crispy. It does take some time to heat up; but once hot, it works quickly. I found that the electrical attachment at the back of the fryer easily becomes disengaged from the unit. So you think it's heating up only to find out the attachment to the fryer came loose. Overall, would buy it again. Happy Frying!
customer_reviews.author: sjg

customer_reviews.title: What a great little fryer
customer_reviews.text: I have a huge 16 lb turkey fryer so I was looking for something smaller to use when I want to fry small stuff like fries, onion rings, and wings. This fryer was perfect. Doesn't take up much space. Heats up very fast. Temperature is accurate (checked against a digital meat thermometer). And just as important it is very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fryer
customer_reviews.text: My last fryer lasted for years and they do not sell that brand any more. Was pleasantly surprised with my new fryer. Works Excellent, nice size basket. Love it
customer_reviews.author: greenhousemom

customer_reviews.title: Electrical cord has weak magnet and falls out a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Slow to heat up and the electrical cord ,which is magnitized to plug in keeps falling out causing it to shut of.magnet is too weak.once heated works great and does the job safely with the cover so there is no splatter to get burnt with.
customer_reviews.author: jack dube

customer_reviews.title: A little small
customer_reviews.text: I didn't look at the dimensions well enough when I bought it but it seems a little small if feeding more than 2 people. It takes it quite awhile to heat up and stays hot for a long time before ready to put away. I thought a utensil came with it
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: We love it.
customer_reviews.text: This came last week Nd we used it several times already. Easy to use and takes hardly no room on counter. Great item with a great price and packed well.
customer_reviews.author: Myrna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Was a joint Christmas gift for my boss. She loves to cook but doesn't have a lot of space in her kitchen due to she has so many cookware & baking and cutlery. You would think it's a restaurant but this is the perfect size when she only wants to deep fry anything for a party of 5 instead of a party of 25.
customer_reviews.author: Nessa Girl

customer_reviews.title: Best little fryer ever
customer_reviews.text: I used this fryer for 10 years when we moved I thought I lost plus (didn’t even think to replace the plug) bought one at a local store thinking I’ll just get a bigger one. I hated it not because it wasn’t good but because bigger wasn’t better. This uses very little oil so not much waste and cooks evenly. It’s not much that I fry top 2 items Cutlets and pastelillos a Spanish treat And now wings. I LOVE this little baby. I got rid of big and purchased it again. Look at the size it’s perfect
customer_reviews.author: Socorro C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Fryer
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to make my french-fryes ! It’s Small, easy to storage, easy to clean ! Get very high temperature fast .... It’s great !!
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Works Great So Far!
customer_reviews.text: This deep fryer heats up quickly and is pretty easy to clean. Seems to hold the temp well. We have used it 3-4 times and appears to work great.
customer_reviews.author: Archagellos

customer_reviews.title: Decent fryer
customer_reviews.text: This fryer is great for frying and the lid seals nicely. The only problem that we have is that the film left on the top is hard to get off.
customer_reviews.author: cviola

customer_reviews.title: Simply love this fryer
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted, I never could fry chicken without making a mess on my stove, now I can not only make my chicken but, No mess! Now the mad scientist will be in the lab making fried shrimp, onion rings, fish n chips and more, look out people!
customer_reviews.author: Bocifus

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but I would recommend this size for a single individual. I will have to purchase a bigger unit to accommodate my family.
customer_reviews.author: Dalb

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: This is such a good buy that I purchased it on 2 separate occasions; I needed one for my home, the other is stored at the family house where we gather frequently for family dinners. All the ladies in the kitchen loved it and are looking to purchase for their home. Cooks food evenly, produces a great crust on fried chicken, easy to clean, and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Dedrell Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Non-superb kitchen assistant
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend told me that this is a great cooking pot, fried fish and fried shrimp have no taste, very clean, you can make delicious food for the children without worrying about soiling the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: ella liang

customer_reviews.title: Best deep fryer ever!
customer_reviews.text: We love this deep fryer. It can deep fry and still food is not greasy. We used to fry potatoes in a pan and often oil could not get hot enough so the potato or other food would absorb too much oil. This deep fryer prevents that. Food cooks quickly and not greasy.
customer_reviews.author: Living Free Forever

customer_reviews.title: Good little fryer
customer_reviews.text: Great little Fryer. It is small but that is OK for us, we just do multiple batches if we are making fries and fish stickes etc. which is OK since they need to cool a bit anyway before eating. The small size also means we use less oil.
customer_reviews.author: Regular Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this little guy
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy! Great for 1 or two diners, or up to 4 diners who have a little patience. Filter is cheap and will not hold up for many washings - order extra. Would like the cover to lock from sliding side-ways when opening - have to pay attention when lifting cover when hot. Cleaning is a breeze compared to my large deep fryer. Good quality, the basket holds enough for 2-3 servings of French frys, and the heater is fast on recovering 375 degrees after submerging food.
customer_reviews.author: chas w

customer_reviews.title: Awesome works great, is lightweight, Awesome Awesome Awesome Product...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome looks like it may be cheap, but it's not it stands up to the Cuisinart brand name... We love it. Highly recommend this deep fryer...
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Tackett

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This fryer is equivalent to a small commercial fryer. It works great is accurate with its temperature and is easy to clean. I had a fry daddy for years but it was hard to use and had no temperature control. This one is great and a great value for the price. We’ve done fries chicken wings and fried shrimp so far. Everything was delicious. Looking forward to many more delicious meals. Oh btw my husband is a retired executive chef and he approves!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Electric Cord a real problem
customer_reviews.text: I read over 20 great reviews before choosing this item however the electric cord just wasn't working for me. I never got to a point that I could use the fryer because my magnetic cord would pop off far too easy. My family was very disappointed so I ran to the store and bought one half the price and 1/2 gallon larger that works great! Still waiting for my refund though!!!! Buy with caution
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Great Deep Fryer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it was smaller. Make french fries for two. Easy to clean I put it all in the dish washer but, not the heating element.
customer_reviews.author: Basil

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CDF-170 3.4-Quart Deep Fryer, Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Size:3.4 QuartDesigned to create delicious family meals and perfect batches of everything from fries to donuts, the Cuisinart 3.4-Qt. Deep Fryer makes frying at home effortless and easy. With a powerful heating element that offers uniform high heat throughout cooking, it perfectly fries potatoes, onion rings, seafood, chicken, tempura - even donuts. Its 3.4-quart medium capacity can cook up to 1.7 pounds of food, making it the ideal fryer for a favorite family meal or crunchy golden appetizers. The control panel makes operation simple, and it offers precise timing and temperature control. Basket, lid and oil container are dishwasher safe for easy cleanup. Features: 1800-watt immersion style heating element for fast heat-up and recovery time|1.7lb food capacity|3.25 liter (3.4 quart) removable stainless steel oil container|Heavy mesh frying basket with cool-touch handle|60-minute digital timer|Power On and Ready LED indicator lights|Limited One Year Product Warranty
feature_bullets: Fries potatoes, onion rings, seafood, chicken, vegetables, donuts, and much more
Medium capacity cooks up to 1. 7 pounds of food with a 3. 4-Quart oil container
Includes stainless mesh basket with cool-touch handle
Control panel offers digital 60-minute timer and temperature control dial
Removable 1800-watt immersion-style heating element for fast heat-up and heat recovery

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,436 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
